Every so often a medical report comes out stating that our chances of catching some horrible disease is 5 times more likely than it was if we continue to do such and such.
 
 Has any one heard or is there published what the original chances were ?
 
 For instance, say, after research has been done, that my chances of contracting cancer are 5 times more likely if I drink whiskey than if I stop.
 
 But what is the base figure ? If it were 1 in 10 then I might (might!) think about it. If the base figure is only 1 in 10,000,000 then I probably won't.
 
 How can one make a reasoned assessment if the original base isn't given ? Or is it the media doiung a bit of scaremongering ?

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Chances of catching something awful
